Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum had 33 points, 9 assists, and 8 rebounds for the Celtics. Derrick White scored 26 points and Sam Hauser hit five 3-pointers and scored 15 points for Boston. Julius Randle led Minnesota with 27 points, 8 rebounds, and 7 assists. Naz Reid added 20 points off the bench, while Jaden McDaniels had 19 points and 8 boards.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Timberwolves trailed by eight with two minutes to play but they had a chance to send it into overtime. However, Anthony Edwards' 3-pointer fell short at the buzzer.
Others: After winning 16 of its first 19 games, Boston had a ho-hum 8-6 record in December. A victory in Minnesota was a great way to kick off a four-game road trip to start 2025. Minnesota began the week with a chance to test itself against one of the heavy hitters in each conference. After a 113-105 loss at Oklahoma City on Tuesday, the Timberwolves came up just short against the Celtics.
